column1: lovely length, squares Khawaja up as he defends from the crease
full and swinging across, left alone
rooted to the crease as he negotiates this full delivery on leg stump
whips this wide of the diving Vijay Shankar at square leg. Delightful balance and wrist work. Bhuvi punished for going too short.
touch fuller, just around off stump, defended
gets right on top of the bounce and turns this short of length delivery into the leg side. Decent first over to begin with.
beauty! Drew him forward with a full length delivery and got it to move away off the seam. Moved a long way away after it passed the bat. That should wake up Finch
nearly chopped on! Looks to force this length ball on the up but he's cramped for room. Manages to scamper a run and get off the mark. Rolled just wide of leg stump.
slants one nice and full across the left-hander, defended
works this full-length delivery towards mid-on. Nice, tight line from Shami
crunching cover drive! Errs in length by a very small margin and gets spanked. Juicy half-volley
whips this from length on middle to midwicket
plants forward, uses the width and flays this on the up through extra cover. Driving without a trace of worry that time. Lovely execution
full outside off, defends towards Jadeja at point as they scamper a quick single

huge appeal, huge appeal but Joel Wilson says not out immediately. Kohli straightaway went up to his bowler to ask if he wanted to go upstairs. They decide against DRS . This was definitely sliding down leg, but worth an appeal? Could've come back as umpire's call
the whip of the wrists! Magnificent. Too short from Bhuvi, Khawaja stands tall and wrists this behind square on the leg side to pepper the short boundary.
stopped well on the followthrough! This was hit back hard, Bhuvi put his left hand out to half-stop.
still finds the leg side gap, but hits this straight to fine leg.
balance and timing absolutely impeccable as he puts this juicy half-volley on the pads to the midwicket boundary. Poor from Shami, no batsman worth his salt will miss out on a gift like this.
beauty! Good comeback. Gets one to angle in and nip away off the deck, Khawaja has a poke but misses.

we're seeing wrist work of the highest quality here! Khawaja plays a magical on-drive to this incoming length ball. The non-striker had to just get his bat out of the way to see this scream away to the boundary.
goes for a big drive, but this swerves in a long way, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on where Bumrah misfields
driven on the up but straight to extra cover
excellent delivery. Angles one back in off a length, Finch plays outside the line to get an inside edge onto the pad.
gets a thickish edge down to square third man
nice and full on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended towards mid-on
shows the full face of the bat as he bunts this length ball back down the pitch
gets a good stride forward as he authoritatively defends this length delivery to cover.
hint of width outside off, eased to third man
driven down the ground but straight to Vijay at mid-off
cracker-jack! Finch feels for one that leaves him ever-so-slightly off the seam as the ball whizzes past the outside edge. Magic, pure magic
thuds into the pad as it slants back in off a length. Finch beten for pace
delightful square drive! You know it's well timed when Ravindra Jadeja gives up chase from backward point.
stands tall and bunts this length delivery back down the pitch
beats mid-off. Delightful punch on the up through the gap. Too short from Shami, excellent hand-eye coordination from Finch.
shows the full face of the bat to defend this back
and beats the bat immediately! Khawaja feels for this length ball outside off with an angled bat
looks to cut, this one stays low to beat the underedge.
tumbling stop by Gabbar Dhawan at long leg! This one was nicely whipped off is hip, saved a couple of runs for the side

direct hit from Kohli running in from cover point but Finch seems in. Khawaja walked into the drive but was cramped for room and got it off a thick inside edge onto the pad. Fortunately for Australia, there was no hesitation between the pair.
slants one back in, defended.
goes right back and across to punch this back
nearly chopped onto the stumps as he looks to run it down towards third man, Pant hares in to prevent a run
works this length ball on off to midwicket
mix-up, mix-up, but no damage done. Khawaja whips to Shami at mid-on, takes a few steps across, but fortunately turns back in the nick of time.
lovely off-drive, no one moved. This is superb, not a bad ball by any means but he just leans into the drive and times it magnificently
driven but straight to mid-off
gets across and whips this uppishly to Vijay at deep square leg
driven firmly but straight to cover point
bunts this straight to short cover
toe-ends a drive to third man. Late on the stroke
bunts this incoming length ball towards mid-off
skids back in to hit him high on the thigh pad. Going down leg as Finch is late on the shot.
punched on the up but can't pierce the packed off-side ring as Kohli stops at cover point
tucks this down to fine leg
full and straight on the stumps, defended to mid-on
too straight, too much leg side and Finch whips this into the acres of open space towards deep midwicket. Jadhav had to run around from deep square. Third half-century stand for the pair this series
punched on the up to mid-off
works this off his hip to deep square
this length ball keeps a touch low on middle, Finch right behind it in defence.
steered down to square third man for an easy single
slants in, keeps a touch low but Finch defends
squirts one off a thickish inside edge to midwicket.
allows the ball to slide in as he steers this length all to point
flicks imperiously to Vijay at deep square leg. This was a juicy half-volley on the pads
gets on top of the bounce and cuts, excellent stop by Jadeja moving low to his right at point
starts with a googly that pitches outside leg, Finch struck on the body as he plays all around it.
steps out, doesn't quite get to the pitch but ends up hitting it off a thick inside edge towards long-on
drifts into middle and leg, he steps out and works this low full toss wide of mid-on
wrong'un on a length, Finch goes back and across as he tucks it to deep square leg.
solid hit! Excellent use of the feet to get to the pitch as he wallops it over long-on. Short straight boundaries but that would've cleared the biggest of them all. Clean hit
rocks back and plays this very late to beat short third man, Bhuvi in pursuit but manages to pull it back in
length ball angling in, kept out.
tucks this incoming delivery to midwicket
right back into the crease as he defends back
solidly behind the line of this incoming length ball as he keeps it out
punched into the gap, Jadhav comes around at sweeper cover to cut it off
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
drifting down leg, Pant can't get across and collect cleanly, but no extra runs outside the wide
steps out and drives inside-out to wide long-off
steps out and bang! Kuldeep didn't even try to put hit hand out on the followthrough.
belted back, somehow Kuldeep half-stops and parries it towards midwicket. He really gave this a whack
lunges forward and smothers this wrong'un with soft hands
steps out and negotiates this shortish delivery into the leg side.
nice flight and dip, defended back
paddled down to fine leg. Predetermined paddle, gets away. Got well outside the line to try and execute that
tucks this wide of square leg. Got well forward and then brought his wrists into play

ripper of a delivery! When he starts like this, he's a different bowler. It's the fizz off the pitch that does the trick. Fires this in towards length on middle, Finch is drawn forward by the angle but then sees this ball spin away just about enough to beat the straight bat to smash into the stumps. What a ball, what a bowler.
drifting into the pads, worked positively to mid-on
lunges forward and smothers this.
tucks this wide of square leg to get off the mark
makes room and cuts to deep point, hint of confusion. Handscomb wanted the second, Khawaja didn't
draws him into a drive with tossed up delivery, Khawaja tempted to drive but lets go
steps out and turns this full and flat delivery wide of midwicket

swept from a long way outside off, the timing and placement is magnificent! Cracking stroke, best part is that is risk-free. Rolled his wrists over the delivery to keep it all along the ground. No chance for deep square.
through with the sweep even before the ball arrived, may have got a thin edge onto it as this lobs over the keeper's head off the top-edge. Races away, lucky runs but he'll take them.
steps out and drives this full toss to extra cover.
tosses it up outside off, he guides it to point

there's fifty and it comes off a well judged sweep shot, getting down low, picking the length ball well outside off - which puts lbw out of play - and rolling his wrists on top of the ball to prevent the top edge
excellent batting! He spots the short ball early, leaps back in his crease and using the full face of the bat, punches it through cover
waits on the flatter delivery outside off and dinks it around the corner behind square leg

good bowling. He tosses it up onto middle stump, and with Handscomb's fondness for staying back in the crease, he needs to be extra careful putting bat to the ball. And he is, with a flick behind square leg

the wrists save Khawaja there as he rolls them on top of a rapidly dipping delivery, and even though he is nowhere near the pitch of it outside off, he is able to keep it down to midwicket. Good end to the over from Jadeja. He looks India's most threatening bowler right now
leans forward onto leg stump and turns the left-arm legbreak to square leg
rocks back against a ball that is only slightly short in length, making room to take it off the stumps, but can't find the gap at cover point
shimmies down a little bit, but Kuldeep pulls his length back just enough that Handscomb is happy to nudge it to square leg

goes for the sweep, taking a tossed up delivery outside off and directing it to fine leg. Might have been risky on other pitches, but here, where there is low bounce, batsmen don't have to fear the top-edge

there we go again. That's Handscomb's whole plan against Kuldeep. Whenever he pitches it up, he gets down low and plays a very measured sweep. Head still, fully balanced and such lovely hands to keep it down
defends the tossed up ball outside off with an open face
hangs back against a length ball angling into him, making room to punch it through the covers
premeditates the sweep, which allows Jadeja to toss the ball up well outside off and beat the left-hander. Or beat him enough that the bottom edge pings onto his own pad
this time the sweep works as Jadeja goes faster and flatter outside off. Single behind square leg
stays inside the line - which seems to be his plan against Jadeja - and drives the tossed pu ball on leg stump back at the bowler. Good dive from Jadeja to stop it
pushes back to defend a flatter delivery on leg stump
goes a little wide of the crease to spear the ball on leg stump but Handscomb's footwork and balance is so good that he has absolutely no trouble driving inside-out to long-off
steps out and lifts the part-timer to the wide long-on boundary. Welcome back Kedar. I've missed you, says Handscomb
poor shot selection - Handscomb goes to sweep Jadhav but this ball is basically a yorker on middle stump and his inside edge basically saves him from an early walk back
shimmies down the track and drives a tossed up delivery, drifting away from the right-hander, to long-off
loops it up from round the wicket and Khawaja taps it down to long-on
stays beside the line of the ball outside off and dabs it to short third man
good length outside off, Khawaja knocks it down to the right of Jadhav, who tries to stop if himself, but his dive doesn't quite work

pulls off the reverse sweep and Shami has a race on his hands. Does well to stop it on the edge of the boundary. Good length ball outside off was basically inviting the shot and the field was placed in expectation of a top edge
full on off stump, he presses forward to block
stays back, opens up his body so he can whip a good length ball from outside off away through midwicket. Excellent batting against spin
defends the tossed up delivery, dipping at the last, on him with a perfectly straight bat. Good spot from Khawaja
loads up the reverse sweep, and even though the flatter, quicker delivery is cramping him on leg stump, he's able to find a single to deep square leg
angles the full delivery into the pads and Handscomb deftly turns it behind square leg
<b>oooh, is that reverse<b/>? Shami is able to get a fuller delivery to curl into the right-hander, but not so dangerously that Handscomb isn't able to pick it away through midwicket
tries to tie him down on leg stump again, but Handscomb whips it behind square leg

that is glorious! Gets up to his full height and swivels on the back foot, totally in control of the pull shot, and the ball just disappears like it finds a pocket dimension that leads to the midwicket boundary
fullish and outside off, he drives to mid-off
beats him outside off! This is sexy old-ball bowling. Hits the deck, gets it to respond and Khawaja's hopeful glide to third man comes off second best

another short ball, this time though he targets Khawaja's right armpit, refusing him the room that was given earlier in the over. The pull shot comes out again but only for a single through square leg
flicks a tossed up ball outside off towards long-on, but Jadeja puts in the dive
with the ball pitching outside off, he's happy to go for the reverse sweep. No chance of lbw. No chance of runs either on this occasion as it finds point
whips the quicker delivery on leg stump to long-on
waits nicely on middle and leg, allowing the flighted ball to come to him, and then rolls his wrists on it, directing it to midwicket
lunges forward trying to get to the pitch of the ball outside off and drives along the ground towards long-off. Jadeja won't allow that
wanders outside leg, picking the length as short, and slices the ball on off stump behind point. Serene batting against spin
walks down the pitch and hacks the back of a length ball straight of midwicket for a quick single.

the short ball isn't working on this pitch. There just isn't enough bounce for that to be a reasonably tactic. Shami bangs it into the deck as well as he could, but it just sits up for Khawaja to hammer it over midwicket. Straight of midwicket even

goes round the wicket - because that last ball had soooooo much room - and he beats him immediately. The length is a lot better - trapping the batsman in his crease - and Khawaja's slice behind point makes him look less than the most in-form batsman of the series
waits on the back of a length delivery to come onto him and the deflects it to long leg
steps forward to the shortish delivery outside off and steers it to point
cramps him with a quick and short delivery on off stump and Khawaja has to jump off his crease to get on top of the ball and knock it down
his back foot play is always top-class. Judges the ball to be short and on off stump, so he makes a little room and gently steers the bal lthrough point
gets down low to reverse sweep the tossed up ball outside off. Finds short third man
a little more power in the shot - thanks to the width on offer - and the reverse sweep flies away to the right of short third man
tons of power on this reverse sweep too - which is surprising since Jadeja spots the batsman's premeditated movement and fires it into the leg side. Single to deep point
drills the tossed up delivery on off stump to short cover. Rohit misfields
goes back and flicks a shortish delivery outside off through square leg

sees Khawaja's intentions to dance down the track and so drags the ball well wide of off stump. The left-hander has to reach out - looking uncharacteristically ungainly - to cut the ball through point
rocks back against the short ball outside off and taps it with practically the full face of the bat to long-off.

this is beautiful batting! He sees the flight on this so early. He charges out to meet it. And he unfurls a full swing of that straight bat. High, handsome, straight, ridiculously cool six! Anmd that prompts a chat between Kuldeep and Kohli
changes his line wide outside off and pulls the length back a bit. Khawaja likes the room and goes for the sweep but he misses altogether
good length ball on off stump, defends
he's already shifting outside off as Kuldeep is walking in to bowl, expecting the legspinner to bowl outside off, and when that happens, he nails the sweep well in front of midwicket.
goes round the wicket, targeting Khawaja's pads, he works it through square leg
loops it up on off stump, Khawaja hammers it down to long-on
gets inside the line of a loopy delivery outside off but in perhaps trying to hit it too hard, he mistimes it back at the bowler. Or maybe he was checking his shot considering Jadeja's dip
full and outside off, he smears it through the covers and Rohit isn't able to get low to his left quickly enough to stop it

drags it way too short - which happens so very rarely with Jadeja - but Khawaja is soooooo good here. Leaps back into his crease and pulling it in front of the fielder at square leg. Splendid manipulation of the field
nudges the fuller delivery on middle through midwicket
short and wide but Khawaja finds point with his cut shot.

there we go, he waits a little longer with this cut shot, hoping to find the gap between point and third man. Doesn't quite manage it but does get the single with short third man having to move to his left
there's the googly!. Handscomb goes down to sweep it and - with the ball tossed up wide and turning away - he mistimes it through square leg
nudges it through midwicket
another sweep - this one to the legbreak wide outside off - as Handscomb finds a single behind square leg
rolls the wrists over the legbreak outside off, largely because it dips on him and he doesn't want to pop it up in the air. Single through cover
almost chops on! Bumrah coming round the wicket for a back of a length delivery outside off. Khawaja is on the hop, his bat coming down at an angle which enables the mis-hit
full and outside off, he drives to cover.
back of a length and outside off, he opens the face and runs it to third man

presents the full face of the bat, even though he's a little squared up on off stump. He has to do that really with Bumrah hitting the deck and getting it to straighten. That strong wrist and the hyper-extension of his elbow allows him to get more from the pitch than most other bowlers
straightens again but Khawaja is ready for this time time, staying back in his crease, waitin for it to come to him outside off and guiding it behind point
full and outside off, he drives to mid-off
shortish and outside off, he shapes to cut, but is beaten
presses forward as he waits for Kuldeep to delivery but the moment he reads the flight and realises this is short, he's back and across, ready with the cut shot
googly which is quicker and closer to off stump. Also keeps low, meaning Khawaja has to adjust, straightening his back leg and cutting to point
another quick googly on and around off sutmp and Khawaja is very nearly bowled as he sets up for a cut shot again. Last minute change to a straight bat slice to point saves him in the end
good length ball outside off - this one turns away from the left-hander, allowing the cut shot to deep point
whirls his wrists over a shortish delivery outside off in an effort to smuggle it through midwicket. No such luck
slower ball, which he picks and plays with the angle from round the wicket to deep square leg
firm push to extra cover as Bumrah keeps banging the ball in at back of a length, hoping the low bounce will help him get a wicket
searing yorker, and it is all the more difficult because of the late inswing. Handscomb just about deals with it, the inside edge of his bat coming in very handy!
follows it up with the slower ball, but Handscomb is ready for that too, holding his shape until it comes close enough that he can guide it behind point

slogs a good length ball on off stump down to mid-on - and the reason it only went that far is because he checks his shot, knowing Australia cannot afford to lose a wicket now. Not when they've taken out two of Bumrah's overs off the death
cuts the shortish delivery outside off to deep point and mores to 99

eases down the pitch and chips the legbreak on leg stump over the infield. The timing is so good that it nearly wanders all the way to the boundary - it has no business getting that far - but Jadhav stops it with a big old dive.

googly gets the edge and it beats Pant! Too thick for the wicketkeeper to do anything about it. Has no time to react. Handscomb backs away to try and open up the off side, but he's given himself too much room and is panicking as the ball turns away from him rather sharply. Gets a big edge, which is lucky for him because it takes the ball well away from the only catcher in the region
full on off stump, Handscomb holds his shape as it comes down slowly and then punches it to long-on

stays back and guides the length ball on middle through cover and jogs through for his second hundred in three innings! Gorgeous batting from Khawaja and Delhi appreciates it. Even this shot - for a single - shows off the reason why he's succeeded on this tour. Plays late. Wiats for the turn. Soft hands.
sweeps the length ball on middle stump to deep square leg
lovely straight drive from Handscomb. Stays legside of the ball, perhaps because there is a little bit of reverse swing out there, and presents the full face
carves the back of a length delivery outside off into the covers and sprints through
mistimes a swat down the ground, the fuller delivery outside off going off the bottom edge back to the bowler
full and outside off, he drives to mid-off
beats him on the pull as Bhuvi's short ball goes under Khawaja's bat

leaves his wicket giftwrapped at Kohli's feet. A harmless ba outside off, tempting the drive on the up. Khawaja obliges, not taking the care he has done all innings to keep the ball down, or away from a fielder. Goes straight to the Indian captain. Delhi roars in approval. Khawaja, meanwhile, is devastated, basically dragging himself off the field.
driven with the spin to cover.
drifts in and skids through, Maxwell defends
drives one and gets it off a thickish inside edge towards long-on
uses the depth of the crease superbly to force this towards deep point where an off-balanced Vijay hurls a superb throw. Saved three runs

back-to-back wickets, Jadeja is pumped, Kohli even more. Maxwell has fallen looking to hit this over cover. Didn't get the elevation because he didn't get to the pitch. This also spun away a wee bit more than he expected, and Kohli is extremely alert at extra cover.
length ball angling into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket where Kohli is supremely alert as he dives full-length to his left to keep Handscomb on 49
nearly chopped on! The slowness of the surface starting to show up here. Looks to force this on the up through cover point.
reverse? Ooohhh, exciting. Veers in late, he defends forward and gets a thickish inside edge towards mid-on.
steered down to square third man to bring up back-to-back half-centuries for Handscomb
length on off, Handscomb defends as he gets half forward
touch ahead of a length on off, defends using the full face of the bat.
driven with the spin to long-off
fired full and flat, defended again.
drifts one in from wide of the crease, Stoinis defends from the crease
slices the drive to Vijay at deep point
eased with the spin, Kohli supremely agile at cover as he moves quickly to cut out the single
touch short, punched down to long-off
run-out chance missed at the bowler's end. Bunted to short cover, Jadhav hurls one just wide to reprieve Stoinis who was well outside the crease.

wicket denied at one end, but Shami provides one at the other, and it's a cracker of a delivery. Lifter that completely takes Handscomb aback as he is forced to play at this because of the length, but the ball kisses the shoulder and flies to Pant who takes a superb catch. Massive break for India. They've come storming back.
what a way to get off the mark! This one tailed in late but Turner plays it late, brings his wrists into play to flick this into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Lovely timing.
driven firmly on the up to sweeper cover, aggressive running to complete the second
full on off, defended from the crease.
plays too early, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad. Rolls to the off side as he tries to scamper a run but it isn't there.
punched on the up to sweeper cover for a single.
length ball sliding back in, defended.
fired full, he lunges forward and blocks
drifts into middle and leg, tucks this into the leg side.
goes for a big drive but ends up getting a thin edge past the keeper, short third man gave up the chase very early
works this with the angle towards square leg. Jadeja bowls out, top spell.
hits the hard length, defended from the crease.
slower and fuller on the stumps, he drops it gently into the off side for a quick single.
slower length ball on off stump, he stands tall and defends
yorker-length on off, squeezed back down the pitch off a thick inside edge.
length on middle and leg, he tucks this with the angle towards deep square
sublime! Too full, right into his driving arc and Stoinis responds with a delightful straight drive
shortish delivery, punched to cover point
wrong'un that squares him up, squirted to short third man for a quick single.
steps out and then jabs this away wide of cover with his pad. There was a stifled appeal from Kuldeep, but obviously  he was too far down the pitch
defended towards cover, single denied as Kohli swoops in quickly
pulled away but straight to Vijay at deep midwicket
makes room and cuts to the cover fielder at the edge of the ring.
veers a length ball into the body, squirted to short midwicket
slower length ball, he check-drives this wide of cover for a quick single
short of length outside off, bunted into the covers
beauty! Gets this one to slant in and then hold its line as Stoinis is beaten on a tentative poke.
defends back to the bowler with a straight bat
right behind the line as he defends this incoming length ball
clobbered over deep midwicket! Too short, picked the length early and gave it a whack
drifts one away but it's too far wide outside off, left alone

picks the wrong'un but hits against the turn in trying to loft this over long-on, no timing and it is well taken. Turner was looking to hit it much straighter, but ended up dragging it. Kuldeep has delivered a massive wicket. Excellent catch by Jadeja
steps out and belts this straight over the sightscreen, onto the old pavillion block. Lovely use of the feet.
makes room and forces this to cover
toe-ends this full toss to long-on
lunges forward and defends.
beauty! Angles one in and gets it to straighten to beat the outside edge.
slants a length ball in from wide of the crease, defended
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to mid-on, risky single stolen
full and straight on off stump, defended towards cover
squirts this to backward point
late movement back in from wide of the crease, Carey gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
stands tall and punches to deep cover
too straight, on leg stump, tucked nicely to fine leg

slower and fuller outside off, he makes room and creams this through cover, Kuldeep runs across to his left from mid-off and puts in a dive to effect a one-handed stop. Kohli runs across some 40-50 metres to slap a high five to his mate
works this off the pads towards deep midwicket
works this lifter towards deep midwicket where substitute Rayudu is late to move to his right. For those asking, Rayudu is on for Jadhav
cramps him for room with a length ball on off stump, defended.
length outside off, bunts this towards point to scamper a quick single. Stoinis was running towards the danger end as Jadeja fired a throw at the striker's end, didn't hit direct.
chopped on! Too close to cut, this skidded through as well to get a thick inside edge onto the stumps. Stoinis' painful innings is over, didn't looked settled at any stage.
flicks, but keep it all along the ground. They beat Vijay's speed at deep midwicket to scamper a second
right behind the line of this incoming length ball as he defends.
bunts this length ball to short cover.
gentle bunt into the off side, wide of point, for a quick single.
nice and full on the stumps, defended.
slower and fuller outside off, turns it towards the man coming in from midwicket
flicks nicely down to wide long-on, excellent work by Dhawan
tucks this length ball to midwicket
thin edge, excellent catch! Deceived by the slower one, Carey looking to glide this behind point but is foxed as he wafts and ends up getting bat as Pant dives forward to complete an excellent catch.
another offcutter, worked down the ground wide of mid-on
defends this incoming length delivery into the leg side
clears his front leg and biffs this length ball over mid-off. Solid blow
hoicked across the line, the mishit lands between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Vijay runs around a long way from deep square and then puts in a dive on the run to pull it back in.
slower and fuller on off, defended past the bowler
whips this length ball down to deep midwicket
did it get something on the way? No, wide called. Good dive by Pant to stop that
dabs this behind square on the off side, rare miss by Jadeja at point and they take a quick single
chipped over midwicket, two? Dhawan can't prevent it. Good running
edged and it races away past Pant's outstretched hands. Deliberately played, although he got it much finer than he would've liked.
scorching cover drive. Held his shape, laced this full delivery away. Pure timing, beats sweeper cover
ripper of a yorker, onto the toes. Squeezed back to Bumrah, who angrily fires a throw at the stumps. Guess what? It ricochets to the third man boundary, what should've been a dot is four runs now
drills this back, Bumrah puts his right boot out to stop a certain boundary
angling in, he makes room and deflects this length ball to the third man boundary, so very clever
mistimes this high full toss into the gap at midwicket
slower length ball, he makes room and punches this into the gap at sweeper cover

right into the blockhole, veering in late, squeezed back to Bhuvi. He goes up in an appeal, the umpires converge and then go upstairs. Soft signal: not out. Replays confirm Cummins has smashed it onto the pad. Bhuvi has a wicket as the decision is overturned. Cummins started walking upon seeing replays on the big screen. Very much possible that Wilson took a guess with the soft signal, another example of why this should be abolished going forward.
gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
slower length ball on off, squeezed towards backward point
sweeps and misses, looked to fetch this leg-cutter from way outside off
backs away to carve behind point but misses this slower ball
swing and a miss. Had a big swing by taking a step outside off
ugly hoick, mistimed to deep midwicket
veers in late, beats the inside edge. They scamper a bye as Pant flicks an underarm throw
top-edges a wild heave, bounces wide of short third man and gathers steam to the boundary. Deceived by the slower one but gets away still. All Bumrah can do is have a laugh
flicks this full toss to deep midwicket where Kohli fires a good throw on the bounce to Pant, who breaks the bails to beat Jhye Richardson's dive.
gets carefully behind the shortish delivery on middle and even though there's a bit of movement for Cummins away from the batsman, Rohit blunts it beautifully
pitches it up on off stump, Rohit eases forward and prevents its date with his sticks
lovely line from Cummins, but Rohit is defying him as if he's a medium pacer. Confident forward step, sweet sound off the bat and the ball scurries to cover
glorious drive as he picks the gap between cover and mid-off, but Finch, running to his left, puts in a dive and prevents it from going to the boundary

hint of an inside edge with Dhawan expecting the length ball to carry on with the angle across him, but Cummins gets it to straighten just enough that it ends up at mid-off's hands instead of racing away through cover
laces the short ball outside off to cover
hesitation from Rohit, after he nudges a length ball towards square leg, but Dhawan pulls his partner through and he's safe, despite Khawaja's throw coming to his (non-strikers') end
there's room to free the arms, but the slow pitch doesn't allow Dhawan to time the ball like he usually does. Cut finds cover
whistles away to the square leg boundary. Mistake from Richardson, the ball pitching on leg stump and asking to be hit. Dhawan is definitely in the mood to oblige
carves it through cover. The off side is fairly packed, but when there's that much room on offer, Dhawan can bring in all his power. Lashes it between cover and point
goes round the wicket and Dhawan, waiting nicely for the pitched up ball on middle, flicks it to deep square leg. Delhi is ROARING
fullish on off stump, Rohit defends.
oooh, he goes for the cut shot and it's a very rare occurance that he misses it altogether. Especially with so much room
opens the face and guides the shortish delivery to point. Little closer to the body prompting a straight-bat shot
lovely batting. He's become so good on the leg side, waiting for the ball, perfectly balanced at the crease, and then the roll of the wrists to find a single at deep square leg
closes the face to turn a fuller delivery on middle to midwicket.
inside edge as Rohit underestimates the movement that Cummins gets. Hits the deck hard, with the seam upright and the ball jags back after pitching to disrupt the batsman's flick shot

full face of the bat as Rohit drives the fuller delivery to mid-off. Phew, just the composure he has to play proper shots even when he's not getting runs off them. The confidence that he can make it up later in the game...
back of a length and outside off, Dhawan guides it into the covers, only this one seems to stop on him, forcing him to check his shot
straying onto the pads and Dhawan sends it on a one-way trip to deep square leg. (It hitchhikes the way back though)
pristine drive from Rohit again, but mid-off is lurking to deny him runs.
back of a length and outside off, Rohit waits on it and slice it away to deep third man
shortish and on off stump, Dhawan has no room to work with and as a result has to settle for knocking it down to the bowler
fullish and outside off, he drives through the covers
gets squared up in dealing with a short ball on off stump. Cummins' strength to pound the new white ball into the deck is helping him get just enough sideways movement

Dhawan walks! And there, in a nutshell, is the value of this outstanding bowler. The effort he puts in. The pace that he has. And the unerring accuracy. #TooGood #Cummins. This is back of a length, but it darts away from Dhawan's bat, bounces more than he expects too, and a punch through the covers instead ends up as an outside edge pounced by Alex Carey.
good length ball outside off, Kohli guides it to point

riiiidiculous! This is a fearsome fast bowler charging in at him, steaming coming out of his nose, but Kohli is so still at the crease, so cool coming forward to the pitched up ball, and so donwright dominant as he threads the gap at extra cover

shuffles inside the line of the ball, hoping to deflect it to the fine leg boundary, but it thuds into his thigh and he has to settle for a single. Cummins, the bowler, gets across to it and tries to kick it at the stumps, but misses the target
slices it! He likely wants to find the boundary in front of point, but a thick outside edge smuggles it to boundary on the right of the third man
hangs back, and leg side of the good length ball outside off, so he can steer it to deep third man
good length on off stump draws Rohit forward with a punch to cover
rides the bounce nicely - and he can do that because he is so still at the crease - to send the shortish and rising delivery outside off to cover point
caresses it to the extra cover boundary. Rohit's driving has been sumptuous in this little innings. It's not always fetched him runs, but here, he takes care to find the gap too
back of a length and outside off, guides it to deep third man

risky run! But Kohli always fancies those. He brings those wrists down on a full delivery on middle stump and knowing he's mistimed it, he sprints across to the other end before Stoinis at mid-on can find the target at the non-strikers' end
reads the length so early - short and outside off - and spirits it to deep third man.
cuts back in off the pitch as Richardson hits the deck, Rohit hangs back, letting the ball come onto him, and then taps it towards point
right behind the short of a length ball on off stump

OUCH!. Cummins again. The sheer strength he has to keep running in and hammer the back of a length produces magic even on pitches that troll fast bowlers for even existing. This rears up at Rohit. Worse. It cuts into him, at high pace, preventing him the time he needs to get out of the way. In the end, Rohit does well to glove it and keep it down
back of a length and outside off, he steers towards cover
waits on the shortish delivery on middle and turns it through midwicket
shapes for the cut shot, but with the ball - shortish and outside off - not quite bouncing as much as he likes, he mistimes it into the covers

breathtaking! All of his quality is condensed into this one moment. His balance. His timing. His ability to read length so early. Spots the shortish ball outside off and simply punches it through cover. No fuss. All boss.
opens the face as he slices the shortish ball outside off to deep third man
rises up to get on top of the bounce of this back of a length ball outside off and blunts it well
fullish and outside off, he drives to mid-off
seam movement into the bat makes Kohli mistime his backfoot drive, which ends up at midwicket instead of where he was aiming (mid-off)
deals with Cummins' bounce welll, leaping off his feet to turn the short ball on middle to midwicket
searches for a quick single after dabbing the back of a length ball on off stump down by his feet, but point is switched on
gets out the on-the-up drive, but doesn't quite beat cover
misses the front-foot pull, which is bizarre because he might be the best player of that shot in the world
plenty of pace  -  143 kph - and bounce as well. Rohit has to be careful, using his wrists to pin the ball down at midwicket

the front foot doesn't quite move as far as he'd like to make the most of this overpitched delivery - and that's entirely because Rohit is wary of the amount of bounce Cummins has been getting all evening - and the mis-hit drive finds mid-off
presents the full face as Richardson hits a good length on off stump
full and outside off, drives through the covers
he swipes at the air in anger after guiding a short ball outside off to third man and not to the third man boundary
thumps the pitched-up delivery to mid-off. Kohli asks Rohit about whether the ball is swinging...

just over mid-on! And only just! Rohit is usually a fine judge of when to kick on. But here, trying to force a good length ball outside off, over the leg side, he is nearly caught out. Maxwell does his best moving to his left, but in the end it lobs over him
pushes it to cover
swivels on the back foot as he pulls the bouncer on leg stump to long leg
low bounce! Rohit is all set up for the pull shot, but the shortish delivery scuttles past his shins, and even beats Carey behind the stumps, which doesn't please the bowler one bit

pitched-up offcutter outside off, Rohit drops it in front of cover point and gets the quick single. Then Maxwell's direct hit at the non-strikers' (no reasons to throw, btw, the batsman was well safe) ends up at the boundary
gets up off his toes to turn the shortish delivery on off stump through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Rohit eases it to deep third man
misfield at cover, but it doesn't really amount to much. Turner is the man in the hot seat after Kohli defends a pitched-up ball on off stump with a vengeance
stays low but Kohli is so switched on that he's still able to glide it away from off stump and down to third man
beats short third man just as he intends to do. Lyon starts round the wicket and Kohli trusts the angle, staying back, playing the late cut, and beating Turner on his left
stays back and whips the good length ball on middle to deep square leg
stays back to defend a tossed up delivery, also from round the stumps, through point
leans over the tossed up delivery outside off and knocks it down to long-on
nudges a shortish delivery on leg stump through square leg
both are happy to nurdle Lyon around, preferring to hang back, letting the ball turn, and deflecting it away with soft hands. Single to fine leg
walks down the pitch and helps the back of a length delivery on off stump away to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, Rohit turns it through square leg

Kohli walks too! Extra bounce does the Indian captain. You'd have expected that from one of the big scary quicks but this is Marcus Stoinis! And boy is he thrilled. A back of a length delivery outside off - ripe for the cut shot, which is what Kohli tries - gets a bit of a top edge through to the keeper. Cross-seamed variation from the Australian allrounder and it does the trick
back of a length, and slow too, but Pant reads it well and nudges it through midwicket
covers the line of a shortish delivery outside off and nudges it to midwicket. Rohit will know he has to bat through the innings
opens the face and steers the shortish delivery outside off to deep third man
he's back over the wicket now that Kohli's out. Good length, outside off, Rohit blocks
lovely bowling! There's just enough flight to draw Rohit forward, but it dips on him, drifts in, turns in too and beats the inside edge as he blocks
full on off stump, but Rohit prefers the safety of his crease, pushing the ball to long-on
vicious cut shot, with the ball turning away from the left-hander. Single to deep point

there's the risk in playing back. Lyon gets the good length ball to bite in the surface. The turn is quick. There is bounce too. And it forces Rohit to hurry into his block. Australia could invest in a short leg. High chance of an inside edge onto pad
nudges the length ball to midwicket
absolutely hammers it. It's short. It's wide. It's so very juicy and Pant flays it behind point. Tons and tons of power in the shot.
meets the short ball under his eyes this time since he doesn't have the room to free the arms
opens the face as he uses the bowler's angle across him to find a single to third man
stays back to the length ball and neatly sends it to square leg
pitches it up on off stump, Pant blocks it
goes for the on-the-up drive but short cover is on hand to prevent the runs
lunges forward - which is good to see - against a tossed up ball outside off and defends it
a shade short which allows Rohit to back away and guide it through cover point
loops it up from round the wicket onto middle stump, Pant defends
a little drift away from the left-hander, who stretches forward to defend the full delivery
drags his length short which allows Pant the time he needs to slice it behind point
ties to whip a good length ball from outside off through midwicket, but the mini-helicopter doesn't quite work from Rohit. Goes straight back to the bowler
ah, the answers are here! Short, half-tracker, and he rocks back to wallop that over deep midwicket.
whips this nicely towards deep square, looks for the second but is sent back
driven with the spin to long-off
shortish delivery on middle and leg, worked behind square to deep square leg
drilled back to Zampa, who is struck on the finger as this deflects to long-off. Ouch, that should hurt but he ain't showing it
googly which he picks and plays with the spin to mid-off.
turns this with the spin to short midwicket
sharp turn from length outside off, defended from the crease
gets outside the line and bunts it into the off side as they scamper a quick single.
allows this to drift in and bunts it gently to the off side.
snuffed out by a beauty! Drew him forward, got this to dip and spin, Pant has a poke and it's taken beautifully at slip. India are in trouble or what.
gets outside the line and works it with the spin to midwicket
eased with the spin too sweeper cover
nice stride forward as he defends this sharp legbreak. Appeal from Australia because they think it was pad first, but surely the impact was outside off.
as a batsman, you can't ask for a better delivery than a long hop to get off the mark. Vijay gets hold of the pull but hits it all along the ground to deep midwicket
chipped but just short of Zampa on the followthrough
shortens his length, skids one through, defended back
goes right back into the crease and turns this into the leg side.
spins back in off a length, defended
off a thickish inside edge to long-on. Stepped out but couldn't get to the pitch
flatter on middle, punched to the man coming in from long-on
works this from outside off towards midwicket, slightly uppish but no harm done
touch short, he makes room and punches this to deep point
looks to play the delicate dab, rolls towards short third man off the glove. Got too close to the delivery.
lovely flow of the bat as he eases with the spin to long-off
jabs it away wide of Finch at cover as they steal a single to bring up India's 100
eased down to long-on, got nice and close to the pitch of the ball
drifts in a full delivery, defended back to Zampa
slices this drive towards deep point, good running as Jhye Richardson is just a split second late to move to his left
this one drifts in and holds its line, Rohit defends
takes a step across and works it with the spin to square leg
punched down to long-on as they jog the single
steered wide of short third man for an easy single
squared up but somehow manages to squirt this between cover and point
waits for this to spin back in as he eases this to short third man
shortish and spinning in, defended towards mid-on
steps out and drives to cover
steps out and whips this full toss to long-on
eased down to long-on as short midwicket can't intercept this firm push
drifting into middle and leg, Rohit nurdles this to square leg
skids one through, Vijay late on the whip as this rolls off the pad to the leg side
cramped for room as he shapes to drive, mistimed to cover point. Hint of a mix-up but they don't take the run
forced back to the bowler
shortish on middle and leg, worked to square leg.
eased down to long-on as they jog the single
bunts this wide of point and he gets to a half-century, Kotla stands to applaud. Rohit's 41st in ODIs
works this down to long-on
turns this towards short midwicket
punches to midwicket
sees the flight, drills this to extra cover

lofted and lofted very well, smacks the sightscreen. Didn't get to the pitch with this one but went through with the stroke and hit it right off the middle. Was hitting against the turn, mind you, but the boundary that side is not the longest.

he's miscued this to long-on! Vijay will be mighty disappointed, because this is an opportunity missed. Not sure why he needed to go for another big hit. Zampa goes shorter, faster and Vijay looks to pull but is cramped for room and ends up getting a top-edge. India are in trouble.
slices this full toss towards deep point, Jadhav turns for the second but is sent back. Suspect he has been saved by a full-length dive.

beauty! Was there an edge? We'll soon find out. Spun away sharply as Rohit stabbed at this, not grabbed by the keeper. Hard to say without looking at a replay, but I suspect Rohit may have just gotten away.
drifts in a quicker length ball, defended.
dabs this gently into the off side, behind square, for a single.
too full, eased down to long-on as they jog the single
bunts this gently into the off side
looks to work this behind square, bounces off a length to hit the thigh pad.
rocks back and slaps this through extra cover. Superb. This was begging to be hit and Jadhav merely did that
Maxwell has fluffed a simple chance at cover! Two drops in two overs, Rohit the recipient of slices of luck on both times. This was nice and full, he drove and failed to keep it down.
gentle bunt into the off side, with the bat hitting the pad. This was a flipper from Zampa
tucks this wide of square leg as they jog the single
steps out but is done in nearly by the drift, Rohit gets a thickish inside edge to short fine. Played down the wrong line there
flatter and fuller outside off, Rohit eases this wide of point
gets a good stride forward and smothers this.
length ball that keeps a touch low, but Rohit is right behind the line
fired in from wide of the crease, defended back
beaten on the sweep. This was fired in, touch too full as well. Rolls off the pad into the leg side.
lunges forward and turns this into the leg side
steps out, nearly gets yorked so squeezes it out
flatter one on middle and leg, nudged towards fine leg.
drifts in a full delivery, defended.

he's out stumped trying to play an ugly hoick, and in the process loses his bat. Zampa has run all over him. Dropped twice in as many overs, but isn't a third time lucky. Zampa sees him coming and shortens his length, Carey does brilliantly well behind the stumps because he could've been blinded by the batsman's movements for a split second. This is an outstanding stumping.
lunges forward and defends this full and flat delivery
nice and full on the stumps, turned back

Gone! Huge, huge. This is a sensational delivery, drifts away and then spins to beat Jadeja's forward prod. Completely deceived by the googly, didn't read it at all. Carey grabs cleanly and whips the bails off even as Jadeja's back foot is just on the line. I wouldn't want to be Kumara Dharmasena here, if ever there's something, there may be no more than a millimeter behind. The practical decision should be out.
squeezes the drive to cover.
tucks this down to fine leg as he jogs the single
goes back and across as he works this towards midwicket
works this behind square on the leg side to get off the mark
tickled and done very very nicely. Fine leg had given up. Tired effort by Khawaja. Poor ball from Maxwell
bunted back to the bowler, was looking to cut initially.
lunges forward and smothers this nicely
drifts in and straightens, Bhuvi defends as he's on the move
driven with the spin to short cover
gets to the pitch and eases this full delivery to cover again
plays this late dab past slip to short third man
works this wide of midwicket for a quick single
skids one through on a length, defended back. Hurried into it.
bunts this down to long-on as they jog the single
cut away beautifully, Kotla roars. Too short, made room and played it really late to beat short third man
fired full on middle and leg, turned into the leg side
worked with the angle to deep backward square leg
makes room and punches this to deep point
drifts in, shorter in length, defended back
uses the depth of the crease and defend this into the gap at cover
deceived by the slower length ball, looks to run it down but is beaten
width and he's flayed that behind point, Zampa does well to cut that off
squeezes this wide of point for a quick single
slips in a full delivery, Jadhav squeezes this back down the pitch
eases this to Maxwell, who stops it well at point
wrists this down to long-on
big turn from length outside off, works this behind square as he walks the single
drifts in to roll off the inside edge to the leg side as Bhuvi pushes forward
turns this from outside off towards midwicket
punched back, good work by Lyon
turns this gently with the spin to short midwicket
stands tall and punches this behind point for an easy single

edged, races away to the third man boundary. Shaun Marsh was no more than a few yards away from the ball but he couldn't even get a hand on it. Cummins' extra pace. Bhuvi squared up as he poked, lucky runs.
dabs to point, looks for a single but Stoinis is quick to swoop in
snorter of a short ball, Bhuvi looks to fend, is late on it as this one rolls off the shoulder of the bat to short third man
driven on the up to deep cover
short of length on middle and leg, he works this behind square to deep square.
loops it up on off stump, Jadhav stretches forward to block
stays back to the shortish delivery on off stump and dinks it behind square leg
lbw appeal as Jadhav gets forward to block an offbreak outside off. Impact not in line
bowls it quick and flat on middle, but thereafter it spins well down leg. They check on the stumping, just in case Jadhav, who is well back in his crease, had his feet in the air. Nope.
shortish and outside off, he slices it behind point
slaps a short delivery outside off back down the pitch but there isn't enough power to beat Lyon himself
loads of turn as Jadhav, hurriedly making room to cut the ball on leg stump, only manages to find cover
keeps out a back of a length delivery on off stump
stays beside the short ball outside off and thwacks it through the covers
he's deceived by the slower ball, coming out the back of the hand. Bhuvi is looking to drive through the covers, on the up, and ends up bottom-edgging it towards mid-on
bouncer as a follow-up, and it veers into the right-hander from outside off, coming up for his nose. Bhuvi sways away beautifully though
cuts in off the pitch again and Bhuvi, standing on leg stump and reaching away from his body, ends up inside edging to midwicket
another sharp short ball, coming up towards Bhuvi's badge, but the No. 8 blunts it well enough
flicks the shortish delivery on off stump with the turn to midwicket
loops it up outside off, Jadhav meets it with soft hands and dead bat
steps out but Lyon doesn't give him much swinging room and with the ball pushed through flat on off stump, Jadhav can only block
goes gung-ho, looking for the long-off boundary, but Finch does beautifully, moving to his right, despite a bad bounce right in front of him, to get the body behind the ball
makes room to cut the ball, but it keeps low and beats him outside off
waits for the short ball to come to him on middle and leg and picks it away through midwicket
keeps low but Bhuvi is somehow able to protect his stumps, staying balanced in front of the wickets and flicking the ball through midwicket

bouncer again, right over off stump, forcing Bhuvi to play, and he does, fending the ball off the bottom glove for a quick single. Good running from Jadhav. He knows he needs to take the strike to the fast bowler
full and angling into off stump, Jadhav defends
goes wide of the crease for a good length ball on leg stump. Jadhav tries to flick it to the fine leg boundary and does in the end do so, off his pads
fuller delivery outside off, defends
works a shortish delivery on middle through square leg
he's definitely not giving up! Charges out of his crease - giving the bowler no indication - and clatters the length ball (which becomes a half-volley) to the long-off boundary
nudges a good length ball on off stump to midwicket
round-arms the ball into Jadhav's toes - like Jadhav himself does when he bowls - and the batsman flicks it to fine leg
whips a shortish delivery down the pitch, Maxwell rushes across to stop it and runs headlong into Jadhav, both men toppling over, and the coming up with the Australian hugging the Indian
full and outside off, defends

slices it through point! There is lovely drift on the ball but it works against Maxwell as Bhuvi gets the room to carve it away. Not perfectly timed, but doesn't need to be once he can beat the infield on a small ground like the Kotla
oustanding pull shot, staying low, which is a good thing on this pitch, and clattering the ball that strayed into his pads to long leg
tosses it up and drifting in on middle, Bhuvi keeps his head once again and blocks.
rocks back and cuts the short and wide delivery to the sweeper
loops it up on middle, Jadhav stays deep and snug in his crease to flick through midwicket
a pretty short googly, which he tries to pull but inside edges onto his own boot. Looks like he picked the variation, looking to hit with the turn
flatter delivery on middle, Bhuvi whips it through midwicket
goes back even though it's a pretty full ball and defends in front of middle stump
backs away and cuts the short ball outside off to the sweeper
clears deep square leg! Well, there isn't a fielder there, so it's even better cricket. Spots the field where no man is in and slog sweeps a length ball on middle to smithereens
quicker and flatter on leg stump, Jadhav taps it gently through midwicket, explicitly so he can get a couple of runs. The fielder is all the way on the boundary so it is perfectly calculated
loops it up outside off, Jadhav presses forward to block
pushes back to block a flatter delivery outside off
hammers the half-volley on middle stump back down the pitch. Zampa gets a hand to it, but then it skips past the stumps at the non-strikers to long-on
sexy little legbreak as Zampa loops it up above the batsman's eyeline, drawing him forward outside off, and beating his edge with dip and turn
works it away through midwicket
into the crowd beyond midwicket. It's a length ball and he picks it so early, getting down on one knee and swinging away. Mighty strike
flatter delivery on middle, Bhuvi goes back, opening up his body to deal with the ball skidding on straight, and whips it to long-on. Such goooooood batting.
well flighted on off stump, Jadhav defends
slaps the shortish delivery outside off through to the sweeper
excellent composure! It's the slower short ball, and he's not fooled one bit. Holds his shape, presents the bat like a ramp and finds a single to deep third man
full and angled into leg stump, Bhuvi fends it away awkwardly towards mid-on
clears that front leg and goes for the flat-batted swat over the bowler's head. No contact
length on leg stump, Bhuvi flicks straight of midwicket
shortish on middle, Jadhav works it away to long leg
targets the body with a short ball, Jadhav pulls down to long leg
launches it straight down the ground! It's the slower ball, but it's gone wrong. Hits a length, sits up to be smacked, and Bhuvi makes room and delivers big time

dropped by the bowler, diving to his left. It's dying on him. It's a very very tough chance, especially in his followthrough, and after seeing the batsman play a pull shot. Wouldn't be expecting it to come his way but it does and though he responds well, diving to his left, it doesn't stick
back of a length on off stump, taps it into the covers
short and at the body, Jadhav tries to flick it away, but it bounces off the thigh pad and Bhuvi pinches the quick single
dabs it down by his feet and it's Jadhav's turn to push his partner for a quick single. Richardson rushes forward to make the run-out, but the underarm throw doesn't work

outside edge! Bhuvi does want to find the third man boundary, but this definitely goes finer than even he would have planned. The short ball at the body is Australia's plan. Bhuvi keeps making room and messing it up
goes for the wide yorker - nails it - but it strays just a touch too far
slower bouncer but Bhuvi is ready for it, tapping it through point
looks for the yorker on middle and leg, but Jadhav, so coolly, flicks it through midwicket. This calm. This unreal calm is a herald for something big...
bangs in the offcutter, but Jadhav is prepared for it, pulling it through midwicket
batting so very deep in the crease, defends a fullish delivery outside off over to mid-on

Pat Cummins you absolute legend! The partnership that has been scaring Australia for the last half hour is broken at it's their talisman that pulls it off. Bowls full. Angles it at the toes, Bhuvi is backing away, that is serious pace for anyone at No.8, and he just scoops the ball up to a backpedalling mid-off

taken at deep midwicket! There goes India's final hope, trying to pull a short ball that is a touch too close to the body for him to get any power, and just a little too much bounce for him to deal with. Tiny bit of a top edge and Maxwell on the boundary does some great work, running to his right and taking a clean catch at high pressure. Australia have been pushed to their very limit in this series, but they've found heroes every single time
bouncer on middle and leg from round the wicket, Kuldeep lets it go
back of a length and outside off, he tries to guide it to third man, but no luck
short on leg stump, works it to fine leg
falls short of long leg as Shami takes on the short ball, pulling it away
back of a length on leg stump, nudges it through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, dabs behind point
lifts a full ball on leg stump away to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, chops it down to mid-on
swings at a back of a length slower ball angled into him and comes up with a whole lot of nothing
another short ball but since it's off pace Shami is beaten on the pull shot again
swings the short ball away to deep square leg. Cummins wraps up a spell that reads 10-1-38-2. #Match-winning
swings a short ball on middle away to deep square leg
pulls a short ball on middle and leg to long-on

caught and bowled. It's the same tactic. Bounce the batsmen out, giving them no room to work with. Shami goes for the pull, top edges it, and Richardson runs the length of the pitch to complete a fine catch
snorter of a delivery that has him looking to evade the bouncer, lobs off the arm guard to the keeper
another ripper of a bouncer, Bumrah wants to pull but Richardson's too quick! Somehow manages to avoid it
squirts one off a thick inside edge to fine leg
makes room and wallops this short ball to the midwicket boundary, good strike.
looks to slash wide of point but leaves, wide called
clobbered, one bounce towards deep midwicket where Handscomb does well. Kuldeep wanted the second, Bumrah refused, and Kuldeep is livid. Fun to watch
banged in short, Bumrah mistimes a pull to fine leg. Over to you, Mr Kuldeep
makes room and slaps this slower delivery to deep point
steps out to pull, Stoinis attacks the body, Kuldeep bails out of it

flattens the middle stump to end a sensational tour! Australia won the T20Is 2-0, and now they come back from 0-2 down to win the ODI series 3-2. Australia's first ODI series win in India since 2009. What a win, what a performance. Massive injection of confidence ahead of the World Cup. Only four times in ODI history has a team come back from 0-2 down to win a five-match series. Australia are the fifth side. What an achievement!
